title: Agmon's inequality
summary: In mathematical analysis, Agmon's inequalities, named after Shmuel Agmon,[1]  consist of two closely related interpolation inequalities between the Lebesgue space L âˆž {\displaystyle L^{\infty }} and the Sobolev spaces H s {\displaystyle H^{s}} .  It is useful in the study of partial differential equations.
